isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS CELECT - 1992-1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING - TESTING HELLA RELAY

svcproc.title: TESTING HELLA RELAY
svcproc.para: To test the relay, use the following steps:

step1.para: With the relay removed, measure the resistance between relay terminals 85 and 86 (coil resistance). The resistance should be approximately 72 ohms.

step2.para: If the resistance is correct, go to step 2.
If the resistance is not correct, replace the relay.

step1.para: Measure resistance between terminals 30 and 87a. The resistance should be less than 1.0 ohm.

step2.para: If resistance is less than 1.0 ohm, go to step 3.
If resistance is not less than 1.0 ohm, replace the relay.

step1.para: Use 12V battery source and test leads and apply 12V across terminals 85 and 86. (The relay should make an audible click.) Use ohmmeter and measure resistance between terminals 30 and 87 with relay energized. Resistance should be 1.0 ohm or less.

step2.para: If continuity is present across terminals 30 to 87, go to step 4.
If continuity is not present, replace the relay.

step1.para: With the relay energized (from step 3), measure resistance across terminals 30 to 87a. The circuit resistance should be 100K ohms or more (no continuity).

step2.para: If continuity is not present, the relay tests good.
If less than 100K ohms, replace the relay.
